discourse_list.title: [\xf0\x9f\x93\x84] Collateral Onboarding Call #7: TUSD/TrustToken + Mooniswap/1inch - Wednesday, September 9 17:00 UTC

content.content: Time in your local-timezone format: 2020-09-09T17:00:00Z  Dial In Details Zoom Call  Passcode:  314223  Intro Welcome to another of our regularly scheduled bi-weekly collateral onboarding call to discuss potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join and present.  For questions, discussions and feedback on the call, please check out this thread   If you’d like to present, check out this thread    Agenda Zoom Call  // Passcode:  314223 August 12, 2020 7:00 PM  Intro by @juanjuan  Presentation 1: TrustToken @rafael.cosman, from TrustToken will discuss this TUSD, TCAD, TAUD, and TGBP.  TCAD Greenlight vote  TAUD Greenlight vote TGBP Greenlight vote  Followed by a discussion.  Presentation 2: Mooniswap @jesssalomon and the 1inch team will talk about liquidity pools on Mooniswap. Followed by a discussion.

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #07  September 9th, 2020 Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  02:10: TrustTokens with Rafael Cosman  09:25: Q&A and Discussion about TrustTokens  25:10: Mooniswap with Jessica Salomon and Sergej  34:15: Q&A and Discussion about Mooniswap  Video https://youtu.be/Vbnn5UaAhUg Introduction Juan Guillén Agenda and Preamble 00:00  As requested by the Community and because of all the interesting projects presented, Collateral Calls will be split into two streams of calls:  Standard Collateral Types Real World Assets   To launch RWA we will have Matthew Rabinowitz (@mrabino1)  from 6s Capital coming back, and Lucas (@spin) from Centrifuge. Both projects have made considerable efforts to engage with the Governance process to move forward. Last call was not enough to cover all the questions that the Community members have. This will happen on Wednesday September 16th, 5pm UTC. To continue with the Standard Collateral Types, we will have Stani and Marc (@marczeller) from Aave discussing their token and Tyler Winklevoss (@tylerwinklevoss) from Gemini discussing GUSD. This will take place on September 23rd, 5pm UTC. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   TrustTokens  [TAUD] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application [TCAD] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application [TGBP] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application  Rafael Cosman @rafael.cosman @Alex_de_Lorraine Presentation 02:10 Currencies Proposal1428×693 155 KB Value provided to Maker1251×802 86.4 KB Armanino: TrustExplorer1251×709 359 KB Report Example1232×735 223 KB Trust Token1246×718 97.5 KB Mint and Redeem825×400 68.2 KB Mint607×713 116 KB Redeem667×741 52.9 KB Discussion  09:25 - Planet X: Is the real time TrustExplorer available for other currencies? 10:20 - Akash: I want to know the full circle, if a market maker wins an auction of one of your True products, how do they get it back to Dai? How long is that going to take?  12:10 - Akash: You are expecting a market maker to have FX broker accounts and have banking systems with all these different currencies, right? What is the settlement process to eventually turn it back into USDC where they could mint more Dai, for example? 16:25 - Akash?: Is your banking account on Signature or Silvergate so that you can do fast transfers? 17:30 - Juan Guillén: Do you have banks in, I guess, Europe, Australia and Canada, so that the wire transfers are local or is it like a combination where you have funds from across the world? 18:35 - Akash: Does Silvergate has Australian dollar for these fast transfers or not? 18:55 - Akash: What are the best and fastest options for the other currencies in terms of creation, reductions or mints and burns? 20:20 - Will Remor: What are the next currencies to be onboarded? 21:20 - Rafael Cosman: Alex, do you want to touch briefly on TrueGold? 22:15 - Matthew: What about negative interest rates? 23:40 - Primoz: If you had TrueEuro, you could put it into Maker and potentially have a high interest Euro which would be a good deal, right?  Links  Trust Explorer - TUSD real-time backed chart Rafael’s email address: [email protected]  Alex de Lorraine’s email address: [email protected]   Mooniswap  Mooniswap Liquidity Pool Token (ETH-USDC) Collateral Application  Jessica Salomon and Sergej @jesssalomon Presentation 25:10 Intro 1inch1177×698 128 KB Moving Fast1067×685 223 KB Intro Mooniswap1068×672 162 KB AAM Revolution1208×619 257 KB LP Earnings Example1034×670 269 KB Comparing Uniswap & Mooniswap877×683 193 KB Arbitrageurs and Virtual Balances Demo1098×601 276 KB 1inch Mission1209×694 338 KB Application to Maker ETH-USCD1121×617 132 KB Application to Maker ETH-WBTC1148×609 225 KB Reasons for Adoption1076×608 58.6 KB First Reason1113×617 239 KB Second Reason1091×616 230 KB Pool Example1294×685 186 KB Poll Example 2nd part1249×677 170 KB Discussion  34:15 - Akash: What is the asset value of these Mooniswap liquidity tokens? What are the maximum stability fees and would it make sense to mint Dai? Do you have a Dai pool? 36:10 - Akash: What is the total size of the assets in these pools? And, what’s the expectation of leverage you are going to introduce in the system? 41:10 - Akash: Does Mooniswap has a token itself? 42:55 - Nik Kunkel: In terms of stability fees, for Mooniswap and the other liquidity token pools as well, what would be the best way to price them and what is the best way to look at the stability fees and collateralization requirements? 44:35 - Nik Kunkel: Can we discuss about the average risk profile of a user who would put LP tokens into a Vault? 49:00 - Christopher Mooney: Do we expect that users would just use it to lever up on the liquidity pool tokens therefore selling the Dai on the market and hopefully bringing the peg back into balance? Would it be more the case for this rather than other collateral types that we currently have?  Links  1inch Presentation Mooniswap Info Dashboard  Closing Comments Juan Guillén Outro 53:30  Thanks again to Rafael, Alex, Sergej and Jess for presenting and everyone else for participating! Let’s keep the conversation going in the Forum. If you have any ideas on how to improve these calls, please let me know. If you want to present a project, please let us know in the Forum thread.  Credits  Gala Guillén produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
Video is up! Summary coming soon. https://youtu.be/Vbnn5UaAhUg
Summary added (in this thread). Thanks to all who participated.
